tasks.task: Constructing and managing a rainwater harvesting system on farmland. Then under that, there are several subtasks. The first subtask when building a pond: Excavating an area for the pond, lining it with an impermeable layer, designing size and depth, etc.

Managing water from rooftops. So setting up gutters, downspouts, and directing water towards storage tanks. That would be a separate task with subtasks like evaluating rooftops, installing gutters, choosing tanks.
Managing conveyance systems. Using gravity, choosing materials like PVC pipes, and maintaining them.
Storing the harvested rainwater. Which includes selecting between above-ground and underground tanks, considering capacity and aesthetics, and maintaining the storage systems.
Purifying harvested rainwater. Using filters or other methods, ensuring water quality.
Understanding the benefits and success stories of rainwater harvesting. Such as improved crop yield, water conservation, reduced carbon footprint.
Promoting sustainable agricultural practices, sharing success stories and educating others.

Understanding the principles of rainwater harvesting and its benefits for sustainable farming). So that could be another main task. Then the technical aspects: building ponds (another MAINTASK: Constructing water storage structures like ponds). Then harvesting from rooftops ( MAINTASK: Harvesting rooftop rainwater). Then conveying the water (MAINTASK: Conveying harvested water to storage or usage areas). Storing the water (MAINTASK: Storing the harvested rainwater). Then, if needed, purifying it (Mantask: Purifying the harvested rainwater). Then operating the system (checking, maintaining, testing). But all these are interrelated.
